content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DSCAT
      operator: equal_to
      value: DISPOSITION EVENT
      value_is_literal: true
    - name: DSSCAT
      operator: equal_to
      value: STUDY TREATMENT
    - name: DSSCAT
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value: USUBJID
Core:
  Id: CORE-000215
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Trigger error when there is more than 1 record per subject has DSSCAT
  = 'STUDY TREATMENT'
Outcome:
  Message: There is more than 1 record per subject has DSSCAT = 'STUDY TREATMENT'
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
    - DSCAT
    - DSSCAT
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0539
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: DSSCAT = 'STUDY TREATMENT' can be used as a generic
                  identifier when a study has only a single treatment.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 2.b.2
                Section: 6.2.3
              - Cited Guidance: If a study has multiple treatments, then DSSCAT should
                  name the individual treatment.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 2.b.3
                Section: 6.2.3
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DS

json.Description: Trigger error when there is more than 1 record per subject has DSSCAT = 'STUDY TREATMENT'

Outcome.Message: There is more than 1 record per subject has DSSCAT = 'STUDY TREATMENT'

Citations.Cited_Guidance: DSSCAT = 'STUDY TREATMENT' can be used as a generic identifier when a study has only a single treatment.
If a study has multiple treatments, then DSSCAT should name the individual treatment.
